title: densmap
description:
A modification of UMAP that adds an extra cost term in order to preserve information 
about the relative local density of the data. It is performed on the same inputs as UMAP.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality from the input MuData file to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality from the input MuData file to process.

uns_neighbors.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `neighbors`. The `.uns` neighbors slot as output by the `find_neighbors` component.

obsm_pca.help_text: Type: `string`, required. The slot in `.obsm` where the PCA results are stored.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file.

obsm_output.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_densmap`. The .obsm key to use for storing the densMAP results..

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects
output_compression.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects.
By default no compression is applied.

min_dist.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.5`. The effective minimum distance between embedded points
min_dist.help_text:
Type: `double`, default: `0.5`. The effective minimum distance between embedded points. Smaller values will result 
in a more clustered/clumped embedding where nearby points on the manifold are drawn 
closer together, while larger values will result on a more even dispersal of points. 
The value should be set relative to the spread value, which determines the scale at 
which embedded points will be spread out.

spread.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. The effective scale of embedded points
spread.help_text:
Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. The effective scale of embedded points. In combination with `min_dist` this 
determines how clustered/clumped the embedded points are.

num_components.description: Type: `integer`, default: `2`. The number of dimensions of the embedding
num_components.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `2`. The number of dimensions of the embedding.

max_iter.description: Type: `integer`, default: `0`. The number of iterations (epochs) of the optimization
max_iter.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `0`. The number of iterations (epochs) of the optimization. Called `n_epochs` 
in the original UMAP. Default is set to 500 if 
neighbors['connectivities'].shape[0] <= 10000, else 200.

alpha.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. The initial learning rate for the embedding optimization
alpha.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. The initial learning rate for the embedding optimization.

gamma.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Weighting applied to negative samples in low dimensional embedding optimization
gamma.help_text:
Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Weighting applied to negative samples in low dimensional embedding optimization. 
Values higher than one will result in greater weight being given to negative samples.

negative_sample_rate.description:
Type: `integer`, default: `5`. The number of negative samples to select per positive sample
in the optimization process
negative_sample_rate.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `5`. The number of negative samples to select per positive sample
in the optimization process. Increasing this value will result
in greater repulsive force being applied, greater optimization
cost, but slightly more accuracy.

init_pos.description: Type: `string`, default: `spectral`, choices: ``paga`, `spectral`, `random``. How to initialize the low dimensional embedding
init_pos.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `spectral`, choices: ``paga`, `spectral`, `random``. How to initialize the low dimensional embedding. Called `init` in the original UMAP. Options are:
  
* Any key from `.obsm`
* `'paga'`: positions from `paga()`
* `'spectral'`: use a spectral embedding of the graph
* `'random'`: assign initial embedding positions at random.

lambda.description: Type: `double`, default: `2.0`. Controls the regularization weight of the density correlation term in densMAP
lambda.help_text:
Type: `double`, default: `2.0`. Controls the regularization weight of the density correlation term in densMAP. 
Higher values prioritize density preservation over the UMAP objective, and vice versa 
for values closer to zero. Setting this parameter to zero is equivalent to running 
the original UMAP algorithm.

fraction.description:
Type: `double`, default: `0.3`. Controls the fraction of epochs (between 0 and 1) where the density-augmented objective 
is used in densMAP
fraction.help_text:
Type: `double`, default: `0.3`. Controls the fraction of epochs (between 0 and 1) where the density-augmented objective 
is used in densMAP. The first (1 - dens_frac) fraction of epochs optimize the original 
UMAP objective before introducing the density correlation term.

var_shift.description:
Type: `double`, default: `0.1`. A small constant added to the variance of local radii in the embedding when calculating 
the density correlation objective to prevent numerical instability from dividing by a 
small number
var_shift.help_text:
Type: `double`, default: `0.1`. A small constant added to the variance of local radii in the embedding when calculating 
the density correlation objective to prevent numerical instability from dividing by a 
small number.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
